intro: Sphaerostephanos angustibasis, commonly known as the narrow-base globeflower, is a member of the Berberidaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant features basal leaves that are narrow and strap-like, with a distinctive reddish or purple hue on the underside. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences, giving it its common name. Sphaerostephanos angustibasis is adapted to cold, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine meadows.
